summary: Email chain between attorneys and law enforcement regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on scheduling meetings with a key witness (referred to as 'WIM' or 'Ms. [redacted]') and planning to contact her family members and other potential witnesses. The emails discuss investigative logistics, witness availability, and the witness's mother being overseas.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle representing a key witness in the SDNY Epstein investigation, coordinating meetings and witness contact permissions.

persons.name: Nathan Werksma
persons.context: Copied on emails discussing investigation logistics and witness interviews, appears to be part of the legal or investigative team.

persons.name: Howie Simon
persons.context: Identified by the key witness as a contact to be reached out to by investigators.

persons.name: Dr. Cabe
persons.context: Identified by the key witness as a contact to be reached out to by investigators.

persons.name: John Larkin
persons.context: Identified by the key witness as a contact to be reached out to by investigators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with investigators planning to discuss specific conduct by him.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as a subject for discussion regarding specific conduct.

connections.description: Both appear on email correspondence coordinating investigation logistics and witness interviews for the SDNY Epstein case.
Glassman's client identified Howie Simon as a contact for investigators to reach out to.
Glassman's client identified Dr. Cabe as a contact for investigators to reach out to.
Glassman's client identified John Larkin as a contact for investigators to reach out to.
Mentioned together as subjects for discussion regarding specific conduct in the investigation.

events.title: Meeting Scheduled with Key Witness
events.description: Attorneys and investigators schedule a meeting for Monday, December 16, 2019, at 11:00 a.m. at Robert Glassman's office to discuss the SDNY investigation with a key witness.

events.title: Permission to Contact Witness Identified Contacts
events.description: Investigators request and receive permission from attorney Robert Glassman to begin contacting individuals identified by the key witness, including family members and other contacts.

events.title: Planning for Family Interviews
events.description: Investigators plan to start interviews with the key witness's siblings and mother, with a follow-up meeting with the witness (WIM) hoped for in January 2020.

keyFacts: The document reveals active SDNY investigation planning in late 2019, focusing on interviewing a key witness and her family/contacts.
A key witness (referred to as 'WIM' or 'Ms. [redacted]') is represented by attorney Robert Glassman and has identified multiple individuals for investigators to contact.
The witness's mother is described as a potential key witness who is currently overseas, not in the US.
Investigators planned to discuss specific conduct by Jeffrey Epstein and/or Maxwell during meetings with the witness.
The email chain shows careful coordination between law enforcement and attorneys regarding witness interviews and investigative steps.
